caption:
HowExpert Top 10 Tips to Master Food and Nutrition for Better Health, Energy, and Lifestyle

What if the food you eat every day could give you more energy, improve your mood, and even extend your life? Imagine feeling more alert, confident, and strong—just by making better choices on your plate. Food and nutrition aren’t just about dieting—they’re about fueling your body for health and vitality.

Welcome to HowExpert Tip of the Day, where we bring you real-world tips from our how to guides on all topics from A to Z.

If you want to learn even more in-depth strategies, examples, and techniques on this topic, check out HowExpert Guide to Food and Nutrition, available at Amazon, Audible, Barnes & Noble, Google, Kobo, Apple, Spotify, and all major bookstores as an ebook, paperback, hardback, and audiobook.

caption:
5 Nutrition Principles we use at @vigorgroundfitness to get our clients results ⬇️ 

While this is a shorter video, below the 5 big things that really move the needle forward when it comes to their nutrition.

While exercise, sleep, stress management, mindset are big keys, this is specifically about nutrition. 

1️⃣ Plan, Prepare, Cook
2️⃣ Calories (Track In Some Way)
3️⃣ Protein Intake
4️⃣ Fiber
5️⃣ Water/Hydration

fullName: Josh Goldy | Women’s Fat Loss Expert
caption:
Comment “GUIDE” and I’ll send you my free nutrition framework.

This video is a perfect example of how simple eating can be:

• Whole, single-ingredient foods
• Meals that actually taste good
• Carbs included (because your body needs fuel, not fear)

Too many people complicate nutrition or cut out food groups they don’t need to. 

The truth is, consistency with the basics beats chasing extreme diets every time.

If you’re tired of guessing, I’ll send you the exact guide I use with my clients so you can finally eat without stress and see results that last.

caption:
✨ Nutrition made simple ✨
1. Aim for 3 balanced meals + 2 snacks a day 🥗🍎
2. Rethink your drinks—choose water 💧
3. Keep fast food & dining out to 2–3x/week max 🍔➡️🥙
4. Balance portions with carbs, protein, and veggies 🍗🥦🍠
5. Minimize processed foods for long-term health 🌱

Small, consistent choices add up to big results. 💪🏽

fullName: Lucy  Upton 🍓 Children’s Dietitian & Feeding Specialist
caption:
I am absolutely delighted to now FINALLY share with you that I’ve have poured 15 years of children’s nutrition and feeding experience into one BIG book, written with YOU (parents) in mind aiming to give you a one stop shop of confidence, clarity and advice about kids nutrition and feeding - from birth to preschool.

My debut book - ‘The Ultimate Guide to Children’s Nutrition; How to nurture happy healthy eaters in the first five years is a ‘bible’ pack full of must-have information, expert insight,and practical tips, this handbook is your one-stop,essential guide to feeding your child in the first five years. It’s being released on the 8th May 2025  and you can preorder now (link in bio) 

It covers:

✅ Developmental milestones and nutritional needs for every stage of your child’s life, from newborn to preschool - shared in a digestible and actionable way 
✅ Judgment-free guidance on milk feeding, whether from the breast, formula, or a combination of both
✅ Expert advice on starting solids: when to begin, introducing new foods, navigating different tastes and textures, safely introducing food allergens and much much more
✅ The toddler years: toddler nutrition, tackling fussy eating, debunking food myths, and overcoming common feeding challenges
✅ How to build a positive relationship with food,promote healthy eating habits, and create a balanced approach to nutrition that lasts a lifetime
✅ Insights on how best your child’s gut health, brain health, immune health and more 
✅ Managing ultra- processed foods (UPFs)
✅ Supplements 
✅ An SOS section at the end of each chapter, based on worried and questions you all ask me weekly - from food allergies to tummy troubles like constipation - with solutions to common concerns 
✅ Real-world advice, myth busting and FAQs from Lucy’s online parenting community
✅ Peer reviewed by six specialists (including dietitians, doctors and psychologists)

❤️ Preorders really do mean everything- especially to a new author like me, as it lets booksellers know publications that people are interested in and want to read! You usually get the book at the best price too!

Thank YOU - this is because of and for all you you xx
bio:
🍓 Leading children’s dietitian & author 
👧🏼 Science backed kids nutrition for parents 
🥑 Helping you raise healthy happy eaters
📕 My Book - Out Now!

caption:
Week 12 of Healthy Eating tips from our Dietitian Lilly.

Be mindful of how much you put on your plate. Start with smaller portions and only go back for more if you’re genuinely still hungry, try to listen to your hunger and fullness cues! This not only helps you maintain your weight but also minimizes food waste.

Check out more at dining.uconn.edu/mindful-dining

Got dietary questions? Feel free to reach out to Lilly at Lilly.Tartsinis@uconn.edu.
